Package gui

Class StateTitle

java.lang.Object
gui.StateTitle
All Implemented Interfaces:
State
public class StateTitle extends Object implements State
Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the first stage where the user can select the skill-level. This class is part of a state pattern for the Control class. It is a ConcreteState. It implements a state-dependent behavior that controls the display and reacts to key board input from a user. At this point user keyboard input is first dealt with a key listener in Control and then handed over with a call to handleUserInput. Responsibilities: Show the title screen, Accept input for skill level, Switch to the generating screen, If given a filename, pass it on to the generating screen Warning: Any instance is intended for one time use. Internal settings are not reset after use. Reusing the same instance over multiple rounds would require adjustments such as resetting internal fields to meaningful values. This code contains refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

  • Constructor Details

    • StateTitle

      public StateTitle()
      Default constructor with internal constraint that method start is called before any calls to handleUserInput for handling user input. The seed is set to some fixed value which is effective if the game operates in a deterministic mode and will recompute the same maze over and over again if other parameters stay the same as well. This behavior is useful during development.

  • Method Details

    • setRobot

      public void setRobot​(String robot)

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName​(String filename)
      Sets the filename. Calling with null does not hurt but is pointless as maze will be then generated randomly, which is the default behavior anyway. The filename must be set before start is called or it will have no effect for this round of the game.
      Parameters:
      filename - provides the name of a file to load a previously generated and stored maze from. Can be null.

    • setBuilder

      public void setBuilder​(Order.Builder builder)

    • handleUserInput

      public boolean handleUserInput​(Constants.UserInput userInput, int value)
      The method provides an appropriate response to user keyboard input. The control calls this method to communicate input and delegate its handling. Method requires start to be called before.
      Specified by:
      handleUserInput in interface State
      Parameters:
      userInput - provides the feature the user selected, in this only start is supported
      value - is only used to carry the skill level, the size of the maze. Range: {0,1,...,15} , with 0 being the smallest maze.
      Returns:
      true if handled, false if input comes before start was called

    • switchFromTitleToGenerating

      public void switchFromTitleToGenerating​(String filename)
      Switches the controller to the generating screen and loads maze from file.
      Parameters:
      filename - gives file to load maze from

    • start

      public void start​(Control control, MazePanel panel)
      Start the game by showing the title screen.
      Specified by:
      start in interface State
      Parameters:
      controller - needed to be able to switch states, not null
      panel - is the UI entity to produce the title screen on
